subject: Re: [junit] Unit test for infinite loop

messageBody:
Hmmm... That's a pain.

How do you know it's an infinite loop (as opposed to just a really long
one)? Do you know that a counter which should be decreasing is increasing
instead (or never going down)? Do you see a duplicate element come up in
what should be a unique traversal? Is there something that is exposed
which you can check to determine that the loop really won't terminate or
something you could expose? There probably isn't much chance, but
if you could, it might make your life easier.

On Sat, 20 Oct 2001, David Corbin wrote:

> I found a bug, so I want to write a test that exposes that bug.
>
> How does one write a unit test that exposes an infinte loop? Well, writing
> one that exposes it isn't hard. How do you expose it with out the test
> hanging?
>
> The only solution I can see is to use two threads, and set a maximum time
> for the test to run. While I've done it before, I really hate putting a
> time-limit specific tests, as every system behaves differently, and they
> behave differently at different times (it's that non-deterministic thing
> that I didn't understand in college :)
>
> Thanks for any input....
>
> David Corbin
